SEARCH
Package com.example.duckduckgoose

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.duckduckgoose.Event
public class Event extends Object
Event model with Firestore-backed waitlist/registration operations. Exposes getters for event fields and utility methods to add/remove users from waitlist, accepted, and registered lists.

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      No-arg constructor for Firestore deserialization.

    • Event

      public Event(String eventId, String name, String description, String eventDate, String registrationOpens, String registrationCloses, String maxSpots, String cost, boolean geolocationEnabled, List<String> imagePaths)
      Creates a new Event with supplied metadata.
      Parameters:
      eventId - - Event identifier
      name - - Display name
      description - - Event description
      eventDate - - Human-readable date/period string
      registrationOpens - - When registration opens (string form)
      registrationCloses - - When registration closes (string form)
      maxSpots - - Maximum number of spots (string form)
      cost - - Cost string (e.g., "$10" or "Free")
      geolocationEnabled - - Whether location features are enabled
      imagePaths - - Optional image path list

    • addToWaitingList

      public void addToWaitingList(String userId)
      Adds a user to the waitlist and synchronizes the change with Firestore. Updates both the event's waitlist and the user's waitlisted events.
      Parameters:
      userId - - The unique identifier of the user to add to waitlist

    • addToWaitingList

      public void addToWaitingList(String userId, Double latitude, Double longitude)
      Adds a user to the waitlist with optional location data and synchronizes with Firestore. Updates both the event's waitlist and the user's waitlisted events.
      Parameters:
      userId - - The unique identifier of the user to add to waitlist
      latitude - - Optional latitude coordinate
      longitude - - Optional longitude coordinate

    • removeFromWaitingList

      public void removeFromWaitingList(String userId)
      Removes a user from the waitlist and synchronizes the change with Firestore. Updates both the event's waitlist and the user's waitlisted events.
      Parameters:
      userId - - The unique identifier of the user to remove from waitlist

    • isOnWaitingList

      public boolean isOnWaitingList(String userId)
      Checks if a user is currently on the waitlist for this event.
      Parameters:
      userId - - The unique identifier of the user to check
      Returns:
      true if the user is currently on the waitlist, false otherwise

    • getAcceptedFromWaitlist

      public List<String> getAcceptedFromWaitlist()
      Returns the list of users who have been accepted from the waitlist.
      Returns:
      A non-null list of user IDs who have been accepted from the waitlist

    • acceptFromWaitlist

      public void acceptFromWaitlist(String userId)
      Accepts a user from the waitlist and updates all related records in Firestore. Moves the user from waitlist state to accepted state, updating both event and user records.
      Parameters:
      userId - - The unique identifier of the user to accept from waitlist

    • removeFromAcceptedList

      public void removeFromAcceptedList(String userId)
      Removes a user from the accepted list and updates Firestore records. Updates both the event's accepted list and the user's accepted events.
      Parameters:
      userId - - The unique identifier of the user to remove from accepted list

    • hasAcceptedFromWaitlist

      public boolean hasAcceptedFromWaitlist(String userId)
      Checks if a user has been accepted from the waitlist for this event.
      Parameters:
      userId - - The unique identifier of the user to check
      Returns:
      true if the user has been accepted from waitlist, false otherwise

    • getSignupCount

      public int getSignupCount()
      Returns the total number of users currently registered for this event.
      Returns:
      The current number of registered users

    • getRedrawCount

      public int getRedrawCount()
      Returns the number of declined positions pending redraw.
      Returns:
      The current redraw count

    • setRedrawCount

      public void setRedrawCount(int redrawCount)
      Sets the number of declined positions pending redraw.
      Parameters:
      redrawCount - - The new redraw count

    • addRegisteredUser

      public void addRegisteredUser(String userId)
      Adds a user to the registered list and increments the signup count. Only adds the user if they are not already registered.
      Parameters:
      userId - - The unique identifier of the user to register

    • removeRegisteredUser

      public void removeRegisteredUser(String userId)
      Removes a user from the registered list and decrements the signup count. Only affects count if the user was actually registered.
      Parameters:
      userId - - The unique identifier of the user to unregister

    • isRegistered

      public boolean isRegistered(String userId)
      Checks if a user is currently registered for this event.
      Parameters:
      userId - - The unique identifier of the user to check
      Returns:
      true if the user is registered for this event, false otherwise
